Speaker: ﻿FILE R-00
Text: Guard Duty
[A quiet African town. The protagonist, cyborg Raiden, rides in a limousine with two African politicians and two people from the organisation he represents, “Maverick”.]

Speaker: Prime Minister N’mani
Text: Three years... We’ve come so far in just three short years...

Speaker: N’mani’s Advisor
Text: The sign of a strong leader, sir.

Speaker: Prime Minister N’mani
Text: No -- the will of a strong people.
[Outside the limousine window on the street children play football.]

Speaker: Prime Minister N’mani
Text: And one very able advisor.

Speaker: N’mani’s Advisor
Text: Thank you, sir.

Speaker: Prime Minister N’mani
Text: Your team deserves credit as well... Mr. Lightning Bolt.
[Raiden’s taking off his sunglasses.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Just doing our job, Mr. Prime Minister.

Speaker: Prime Minister N’mani
Text: I must admit, I once thought of groups like yours as opportunists -- enablers of war. But you’ve trained our new army well -- order has returned sooner than expected.
[There are many armed soldiers and military equipment on the street.]

Speaker: Prime Minister N’mani
Text: Perhaps I was wrong about these "private military companies"...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: We prefer "private security provider," sir. Most of Maverick’s contracts do focus on security.

Speaker: Prime Minister N’mani
Text: Yes, well, "security" can mean many things…
[The camera flies out of the limousine and shows us that there are several heavily armed APCs in front of it.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: There’s a saying I like: "One sword keeps another in the sheath." Sometimes, the threat of violence alone is a deterrent. Sometimes, by taking a life, others can be preserved. It’s the code the samurai lived by…

Speaker: Prime Minister N’mani
Text: Mm… A soldier and a philosopher. You are full of surprises Mr. Lightning Bolt.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I could say the same about you, Mr. Prime Minister.
[The limo suddenly stops.]

Speaker: N’mani’s Advisor
Text: What is happening?

Speaker: Courtney
Text: Someone’s blocking the lead vehicle… Hold on.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: Clear the road! This is official state business!
[A samurai with a long red katana walks onto a wide dusty road. He is wearing ultramodern military armor and cyborg enhancements. The samurai swiftly unsheaths his sword.]

Speaker: Soldier
Text: I said, clear the road! We’re authorized to use force if you do n--

[The samurai runs quickly to the APC. The soldier starts shooting at him, but the samurai dodges each shot. He bounces up and cuts down the machine gun together with the soldier. The military begins to surround him.]

Speaker: Courtney
Text: Leopard One! U-turn! Turning back!
[The limo is leaving quickly. The samurai smiles radiantly at the soldiers who surround him.]

Speaker: Soldier
Text: Open fire!

Speaker: N’mani’s Advisor
Text: Who was that?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: A cyborg…

Speaker: Gemini
Text: One of our competitors?

Speaker: Radio (Boris)
Text: Courtney! What is happening?

Speaker: Courtney
Text: We got hit, sir. A cyborg.

Speaker: Radio (Boris)
Text: Whose?

Speaker: Courtney
Text: XIFF comes up "unaffiliated."

Speaker: Radio (Boris)
Text: I’ll notify all checkpoints. Get N’mani out of there!

Speaker: Courtney
Text: Yes, sir.

Speaker: N’mani’s Advisor
Text: We are going to die...

Speaker: Prime Minister N’mani
Text: Stay calm.

Speaker: Courtney
Text: He’s got friends! On our twelve!

Speaker: Radio (Boris)
Text: Raiden!

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I’m on it. Guard the prime minister.

[He gets out of the limo and in one swift movement takes off his jacket with his shirt, exposing the mechanical body. When he opens the suitcase, he pulls his electric sword out of there. With a few quick swings he destroys the containers above, blocking the way for the enemy soldiers to reach the limousine.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Let’s get this over with.
[The battle with the first three soldiers begins.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Take out those hostiles!
[Raiden quickly kills the soldiers.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Raiden, you’ll need to choose between light and heavy strikes to match the situation! Where are you going? Stay on your targets! Raiden, the limo is in trouble! Get back there ASAP! I’ll add the line to your soliton radar!

[Raiden cuts the gate and runs on. Meanwhile, Gemini also kills soldiers... split in two. Unexpectedly, an unmanned Metal Gear RAY jumps out of the water and fires its main weapon in the head. The limousine flips over. Gemini runs towards him, but then Sundowner appears. He chops off one Gemini’s hands and, smiling, cuts off the other’s head with scissors. He picks up the prime minister. At the same time, Raiden runs up to the limo.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Stop!

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: So you’re Jack.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: What do you want with the prime minister?

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: I want him... dead. Nothing personal, ’course. Africa’s just gettin’ a bit too peaceful.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: What?

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: Business ain’t been the same since they shut down SOP. "A clean break from the war economy." Well some of us liked that economy. How’s an honest war monger supposed to make a living?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: This is your answer?
[Sundowner laughs and pulls a sword out of the sheath.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Don’t do it!

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: Don’t worry now, I won’t. Not while he’s still useful. So long...
[He jumps on the building. Raiden tries to run after him, but Sundowner signals Metal Gear RAY and it blocks his way. An unequal fight begins.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: What?! They have a Metal Gear? Here?! Raiden! Take out that UMG and get after him! Use Blade Mode to damage its armor! Use your Ninja Run to deflect those shots! Now, Raiden! Bring it down! Stop that blade! Yes! Yes! Split it wide open!
[Raiden evades the shots, fights off the bullets with his sword, blocks the strike of a huge sword, lifts and throws Metal Gear on the asphalt and cuts it in half.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Horosho! (Good!) Very good! But do not rest easy just yet! He is on the other side of that collapsed building! Go!
[Raiden’s going after Sundowner.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: There! Get him! Use your Ninja Run to move over obstacles automatically. Do not let him out of your sight! You must catch him!
[On the rooftop of a building the same Metal Gear suddenly comes back and attacks Raiden.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: That damn UG! It still works?! Raiden, use Blade Mode to take down those HEMP missiles! Finish that bastard off!

[Raiden chops up missiles with his sword, jumps on rockets like a staircase, runs vertically down a collapsing building and at the end chops an iron monster from nose to tail. Meanwhile, the African military is surrounding Sundowner. Not interested in fighting with them, he makes a huge jump and hops on a train.]

Speaker: Soldier
Text: The hell? Dammit.
[Raiden’s already running after him. He’s getting on the train, too.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: He is headed for the front of the train! After him! Raiden, an unidentified tiltrotor is headed your way. Keep an eye out for it.
[After reaching the front car, Raiden sees Sundowner and that samurai, Sam.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Prime minister!

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: Too little, too late, hero. I won’t be needing my little shield here any longer.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Stop!
[Sundowner makes a gentle cut on the neck of the African Prime Minister.]

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: What about all the good things war has done for us? Why don’t we ever hear speeches about that? Jobs, technology, a common purpose...

Speaker: Prime Minister N’mani
Text: Raiden... Forget me. Stop him.

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: You ain’t listenin’...
[Raiden’s trying to stop the bullying, but he’s got Sam in his way.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Mind if I cut in?

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: All we’re saying is... give war a chance!
[Sundowner is piercing the Prime Minister. His blood splashes on Raiden’s face.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: No!
[Sundowner dumps the Prime Minister’s body off the train. Sam’s shaking off his blood. The plane arrives and picks up the smiling Sundowner.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Out of my way!

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: He’s all yours, Sam.

Speaker: Sam
Text: Let’s go.
[The fight is starting, but Raiden clearly lacks the experience to fight Sam.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Now, now. Don’t be shy. Walked right into it. Not good enough. Self-taught... and not half-bad. Still... Your technique lacks something... Now I see. You deny your weapon its purpose.
[Raiden is shocked. Sam smiles and takes the moment to cut out Raiden’s eye.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: It yearns to bathe in the blood of your enemies... but you hold it back.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: No… My sword is a tool of justice.
[Sam makes a distraction and chops off Raiden’s right arm.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Shit! Not again…
[He’s doing his best to fight Sam, but it’s a pretty pathetic sight.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Raiden! Are you all right?! You are almost clear of the tunnel! Just hang on!

Speaker: Sam
Text: Oh, did you want to practice first? Gotta try harder than that.
[Eventually, Raiden gets off the train. He holds the edge with one hand.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: This is what happens when you bring a tool to a swordfight... It’s over.
[He swings, but then the train leaves the tunnel. Sam notices something.]

Speaker: Sam
Text: Lucky devil...
[APC approaching the train on the left. Boris is sitting on the submachine gun seat. He fires at Sam. The samurai has to defend himself.]

Speaker: Boris
Text: Kept you waiting, eh?
[There’s a plane coming for Sam. Boris takes out an RPG.]

Speaker: Boris
Text: Down you go.
[He shoots, but his rocket gets hit.]

Speaker: Boris
Text: Flares?!
[Raiden punches a container on which he lies and passes out.]

Speaker: FILE R-01
Text: Coup d’État (Rebellion]
[Raiden is flying a small single-seater jet fighter across a stormy ocean.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: How is it, Raiden?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: So far, so good. I’ve got a clean visual.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: A direct feed to your optic nerve. Yes, I should hope so, eh? I mean... How does it feel!? To fly like a bird!

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Like a bird strapped to a remote-control rocket...

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: We will get you in safely, tovarich . Just relax and enjoy the ride.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Right.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Can you hear me, Raiden?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Doktor.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Remember the two procedures to maintain your new body: One, seizing nano-repair units from your foes. And two--Absorbing their electrolytes.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I got it.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Yes, enemy cyborgs should provide plenty of MCFC electrolytes once you slice them open and... extract their fluids.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: They’re terrorists. I was planning on that any way.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Oh, and their left hands, if you please.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Excuse me?

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Their combat data, stored on holographic memory, typically located in the left hand. That data is very valuable. Ehem... I am authorized to offer you upgrades and services in exchange for it.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: How generous.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Ich liebe Kapitalismus! (I love capitalism!) Had the wall come down a few years earlier, I would have a Nobel Prize on my shelf.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: --There. I see land.

Speaker: Courtney (via codec)
Text: Three mikes out and closing. No activity at the air base. Looks like we don’t need to worry about interceptors.

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: Great, then we have time for a quick briefing.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I know you miss me, Kev, but I’ve been all over the materials.

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: That’s what you said before Montenegro. Look, just humor me, buddy. Objectives, of course, are enter Abkhazia, neutralize the terrorists, and restore the rightful government or what’s left of it anyway. The president and most of the cabinet have been killed, and a military junta’s been established. The terrorists brain-jacked all the high-ranking officers, and their cyborgs scattered the rank-and-file. The few leaders who survived have no way of openly opposing the now regime. That’s why they called us.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Andrey Dolzaev, leader of the occupation forces. An extremist, linked to both the St. Petersburg massacre of 2015, and last year’s terror spree in Georgia. And his arms supplier? None other than Desperado Enforcement, LLC.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: N’mani’s killers.

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: If we don’t stop them here, they could destabilize the entire region. But our more immediate problem... is Jetstream Sam. I believe you’ve met.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: The only problem see is that nickname. I’ve got my enhancements this time. He won’t be an issue.

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: He may not even be in-country, but keep an eye out just in--
[Boris is twisting his face. The situation’s not very clear - maybe Kevin fart?]

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: Oh… Uh... sorry.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Ready for insertion.
[He jumps out of the jet in style and lands on the water, showing off his new outfit in all its glory.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Raiden, you landed safely, da?  First, head inland. The waypoint is marked on your soliton radar. Contact us on codec if you have questions.
[Raiden goes up the stairs from the beach to the city. Three soldiers attack him from the nearest building.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: The bastards are using stealth camo to ambush you. Nice try, but it won’t do any good against a state-of-the-art cyborg like you, eh? The parry incoming hits, throw out your own barrage of light attacks while your foe is on the offensive!
[Raiden kills their soldiers and cuts out their mechanical parts.]

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: Had your fill?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: With this body, I could take these guys with no eyes. Intel wasn’t exaggerating on the cyborg count.

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: Well, you know how fast the tech’s been spreading these last few years. That CNT muscle fiber packs the power of a jackhammer into every limb. What enterprising soldier of fortune could resist? And cyborgs are still human... real, thinking people. Way less risk of collateral damage than your typical UAV strike.

Speaker: Courtney (via codec)
Text: And don’t forget the PR angle. Nations start playing Frankenstein with their troops, and the public goes nuts; PMCs, on the other hand, are off the ethical radar,

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: Yeah, they still don’t even count PMCs in official death tolls. With SOP out of the picture, private militaries needed a new edge on the market. We got it.

Speaker: Courtney (via codec)
Text: In a way, cyborgs are just SOP troops by another name, only all muscled up and less predictable.

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: But it makes you wonder… Where’d Desperado find these guys?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I’m not complaining. They’re like walking vending machines.

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: Right. Vending machines full of blood...  WHAH! Easy there, Dracula. Like I said, they’re still people.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: People who terrorize and take innocent lives for money. They sowed their fate when they took this job. I’m just the reaper.

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: Damn... Bit cold, Raiden. Even for you. Anyway... Uh, it’s cool. Let’s get to work. Time to increase the peace.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Right.
[Raiden enters a dilapidated building.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Raiden, this is Boris. Give me your status.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Looks clear. No one in sight.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Good. Let’s recap the route you will take. As I said, the enemy’s HQ is in the refinery along the coastline. Dolzaev has been spotted there using satellite photography... Also on-site: Mistral, a Desperado captain.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: So I go through the city, cross the bridge into the old town, then head down to the rear of the refinery.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Still, I think they anticipate us. They will probably have a grand reception awaiting you at the old city. Do not let your guard down. Hostiles in the lower corridor, I see. Try to flank them, or approach from behind.
[Raiden kills the soldier quietly, like a ninja.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Excellent, Raiden! Raiden, take that main thoroughfare. You can use Augment Mode to see where the enemy is located. Your body analyzes radar and IR data to construct your AR display. Some civilians are still in the city. That is not good…
[Soon, Raiden sees a soldier questioning a civilian.]

Speaker: Soldier
Text: What are you doing here? This area’s off-limits!

Speaker: Civilian
Text: What? No! I am not doing anything!
[Raiden kills the soldier and starts fighting an entire squad.]

Speaker: Soldier
Text: Enemy sighted. Contact! Found him.
[Raiden destroys the squad and approaches the civilian.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: He is scared to death, Raiden! Let him know he’s safe.

Speaker: Civilian
Text: Oh, thank you! Thank you! I will not forget this!

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Very good, Raiden! Now, keep heading for refinery.
[Raiden goes on, kills some soldiers from behind and meets his first Gekko.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Raiden, wait! We’re picking up a wireless transmission near your position. From the frequency, most likely an enemy data terminal... Check it out. We may be able to salvage some intel.
[Walking down the corridor of a brick building, Raiden hears a mystical computerized voice.]

Speaker: Voice
Text: Greetings, cyborg.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Show yourself.

[Before Raiden, with his sword ready, goes around the corner he’s attacked with a saw on something flexible. In a split second, Raiden manages to dodge a deadly weapon so it doesn’t cut off his head. The saw cuts a part of the building and Raiden falls out on the street. Once he lands, he cuts down the wreckage and containers falling on him. There was a metal dog hiding behind one of the containers with a saw on its tail. There was a brief clash between Raiden and the dog.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: And you are?

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: I am IF prototype LQ-84i.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: IF prototype?

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: Interface prototype. All autonomous UGs feature high-level onboard artificial Intelligence. An additional prototype interface enables verbal communication. I possess an intellect far beyond human reckoning.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: You don’t say. Okay then: What’s the meaning of life? Why are we here?
[Blade Wolf throws some red-hot knives at Raiden. Raiden repels the attack.]

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: I am here to kill you.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: That’s it? Pretty simple thinking for such a mighty intellect.

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: I may analyze orders, but I may not disobey them. Should I disobey a direct order, my memory would be wiped. I must destroy you.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: What good is an intellect if you can’t use it?

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: Your taunting is pointless. Exterminate!
[Blade Wolf climbs on the roof of a small building, roars and the battle begins! Soon the robot realizes that it won’t be possible to kill Raiden quickly.]

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: A savvy warrior uses all of his tools. Backup required!
[He roars and three soldiers show up. The truth is, for Raiden, it’s not the enemy, it’s more of a way to make up for run-down machine oil.]

Speaker: Soldier
Text: You little --

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: Is this all the human mind is capable of?
[After Raiden is easily dealt with the three soldiers, Blade Wolf again has to fight on its own.]

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: I will exterminate your consciousness.
[However, the Wolf gets punched in the nose again and has to retreat.]

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: To continue alone would be foolish. Help me!
[He calls one Gekko, who is also no danger to our hero.]

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: What do you fight for?
[Raiden chops Gekko into little pieces and the Wolf has to step into battle again.]

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: You will die. I will obliterate your consciousness. I feel no pain. Reengaging. S-Stop...! Cannot... continue...
[Raiden wins the battle and he gets a call from the Wolf, LQ-84i.]

Speaker: LQ-84i (via codec)
Text: Directive... liberate... nation... ensure freedom... Obey directive... must obey directive... no freedom... Freedom... undefined.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: What would an AI know about freedom…

[Raiden goes on and fights some soldiers who figured out to take the shield against his sword. When he goes out on the bridge, he gets fired on by attack helicopters. The bridge collapses and Raiden has to run fast on it, dodging bullets. At the other end of the bridge, Raiden decides to take a fight to a stuck-up helicopter. He shoots at it with Stinger lying nearby and chops it with his sword. At the end, Raiden just jumps rockets and cuts the helicopter in half. Raiden continues his journey and sees several soldiers captured a civilian.]

Speaker: Soldier 1
Text: You gotta be pretty stupid to try and hide here...

Speaker: Soldier 2
Text: Looks to me like Russian spies.

Speaker: Captured civilian
Text: I... We are just...

Speaker: Soldier 2
Text: Well we can’t let ’em give away our position...

Speaker: Soldier 1
Text: Waste ‘im. We’ll fill out the paperwork later.
[Raiden attacks them.]

Speaker: Soldier 1
Text: This ain’t over!

Speaker: Soldier 2
Text: Target located.
[Raiden kills them all.]

Speaker: Captured civilian
Text: You... you saved my life! Thank you!
[Raiden approaches the large gates behind which a residence is located.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: So that’s where they’re holed up.

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: Some kind of electronic lock on the gate...

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Most likely it opens only if you have the right ID data stored in your left hand. Perhaps you could find a cyborg with access, and - ah - borrow it?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: You see any cyborgs around here, Dok?

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: Why not double back? Check the vehicle route again? You know, back at the entrance to the old city. Heh, who knows? Maybe you can hitch a ride. Most likely platoon commanders carry correct ID data for the gate. Use Enhanced Mode to figure out who to hit.
[Raiden decides not to bother and just cuts the locks on the gate.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Ah, I should have guessed you would choose this route…
[Raiden kills a whole squad of soldiers and walks into the building. After climbing the upper floors, Raiden examines the area using his enhanced vision.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Dolzaev.
[Dolzaev says something to the woman and threatens her with a gun.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: That woman...
[The woman notices him and sends him an air kiss. Raiden gets up in the protective rack.]

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Raiden, what’s happening? Your heart rate spiked...
[Raiden abruptly closes the video communication window. The woman’s already gone somewhere.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Yeah. I just dodged a bullet. All right. I’m heading for the refinery.
[Along the way, Raiden is destroying a lot of soldiers and Metal Gears.]

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: There was classified data embedded in that hand. It appears that man underwent modification at a Patriot facility... just as you did!

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: We intercepted all for backup during your list fight. The caller’s position is on your soliton radar. You can engage if you wish, it is your choice. Raiden, the cliff is just ahead, at the end of the old city. Beyond that is the refinery’s backyard.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: So, what, it’s a sheer drop? The refinery’s not connected to the city at all?

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: No. It was only built two years ago. There should be a narrow path around there that leads to the plant. It is protected by a fence, but probably you can cut your way through.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Probably.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Don’t get cocky. Most likely it is Desperado running security down there.
[Raiden cuts the gate and enters the territory of the refinery. He’s being attacked by some kind of egg-shaped robot with three hands on the sides.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Watch out! They keep on coming!
[After defeating the robots, Raiden cuts down the fan and enters the plant itself.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Dolzaev and his team must be in here. Find him. Raiden, wait! There are active IR sensors in the area. Part of factory security, no doubt, but the enemy may be using it...
[Raiden starts chopping up enemy soldiers for parts.]

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: More classified Patriot information was in that man’s holographic memory.
[After dealing with the soldiers, Raiden climbs the stairs to the top of a massive cistern. That’s where he meets the woman he’s seen before.]

Speaker: Woman
Text: I was wondering when you’d come... Jack the Ripper.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: No one calls me that anymore. Dolzaev. Where is he?

Speaker: Woman
Text: I can show you a better time than that crusty old bear.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: You’re in charge here?

Speaker: Woman
Text: I am "Mistral" -- the Cold Wind of France. And you... your reputation precedes you. Liberian, but white as snow... A natural-born killer, even as a child...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: That was a long time ago.

Speaker: Mistral
Text: I was born in Algeria myself, you know. I’m only half French.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: And?

Speaker: Mistral
Text: We had our own civil war in the 90s. So you see? Cut from the same cloth, you and I.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: You don’t know me.

Speaker: Mistral
Text: I lost my whole family, everything... But butchered those fuckers. My family’s killers. That’s when I realized... I am a killer, too. And a good one at that. I slaughtered dozens in Iraq, in Afghanistan... I’d found my calling.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Proud of that, are you?

Speaker: Mistral
Text: What happened, happened. To be honest, I found it quite dull.
[She’ll drop her cape and expose the armor and some construction on her back with six connectors.]

Speaker: Mistral
Text: My enemies fell like domino, one after another. Not once did I feel threatened. I was adrift... without challenge... without purpose... At times, I even envied my prey. At least they had a cause to die for. And then... I met him.
[Raiden is being attacked by a three-armed robot. He easily chops it up.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Who?

Speaker: Mistral
Text: And I know what I’d been missing. His ideals gave my life meaning. Ideals, Jack. What are yours?
[Raiden gets confused. He wasn’t expecting that question.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I… protect the weak.

Speaker: Mistral
Text: Still… so naive.
[She picks up a chopped robot and rips off his hands. The robot squeals like it’s alive.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: And if I must kill to protect them... then so be it.
[Mistral splits the robot’s leftovers in half with her heel.]

Speaker: Mistral
Text: It seems we have less in common than I thought.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I’ll take that as a compliment.

Speaker: Mistral
Text: If you would kill for your ideals. then surely you are ready to die for them!
[She calls on the three-armed robots and they share their hands by inserting them into the connectors on her back. Mistral herself screams during the procedure as if she were being raped.]

Speaker: Mistral
