Text: Yeah, just remember that.
[At that moment, a police car pulls up to his car. A policeman shoots him through the window without warning.]

Speaker: Policeman
Text: Pullover.
[Boris calls Raiden and utters one of the most beautiful Russian-English phrases in the world.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Raiden, what is this hernya?! (shit?!) You cannot resign.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Sorry, Boris, it’s done. Can’t have a Maverick employee involved in a corporate raiding, now can we?

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: You could at least come talk to me!

Speaker: Raiden
Text: No. It was time to break away from the old team, Boris. Past time.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: You cannot take on Marshal all by yourself!

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I won’t sit by while they butcher little kids and ship their parts around like meat. It’s sick.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: It’s not all so simple, Raiden. They import those brains legally, for medical purposes. It’s all done --

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Being legal doesn’t make it right.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Raiden, I --

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Hold that thought.
[He brakes sharply when he sees a police cordon. That makes some driver crash into a fire hydrant.]

Speaker: Driver
Text: Fuck you, asshole!
[The road is further blocked by an iron fence. There are a lot of police cars and well-armed policemen around.]

Speaker: Policeman
Text: Fire!
[Raiden’s car is being shot with a rocket. It takes off in the air and flies an iron fence. Raiden and Blade Wolf get out of the car.]

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: I will patrol ahead.

Speaker: Police Captain
Text: Military cyborg: You are not licensed to operate in this area. You are in violation of state and federal law.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Guess you better arrest me then.
[All policemen are laughing nastily. The police captain pulls out his radio.]

Speaker: Police Captain
Text: 18-3-104.7 "Threatening a Peace Officer." Deadly force is authorized.
[Raiden prepares his sword and starts slicing. He cuts off the police captain’s hand.]

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: More Patriot intel! Bring me more and maybe I can develop something… Interesting from it.

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: The road is blocked by barricades. We will proceed through the buildings. You will follow me.
[Raiden’s moving on, killing cops and robots.]

Speaker: Policeman
Text: HQ! Requesting this zone be designated for heightened security. Roger. Upgrading security status.
[When Raiden walks into the mall, Boris calls him.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Raiden, what’s your status?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: They trashed my car. I’ll have to go the rest of the way on foot.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: ...Do you really have to do this?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Look… I’m fed up, with all of it. Companies like ours -- yours bend the laws when it suits business. Why not bend it when it can save innocent lives?

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Raiden...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Boris, listen to me. That VR training... They’ll be warped into killing machines. They’ll be set on POWs, civilians... It’ll be one atrocity after another.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Like what you went through...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: We can’t have any more Jack the Rippers. You saw what happened with George. I’m doing this, Boris. I have to. I can’t save those kids from becoming cyborgs, but I can stop them from becoming murderers.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Say you succeed -- say you get all the brains back. Then what?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Just so happens I know un great cybernetic surgeon.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Doktor. But he cannot--

Speaker: Raiden
Text: You won’t change my mind, Boris. This is my fight now.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: And your wife and son? What of them?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: They’re in New Zealand. Safe. Rose would understand why I have to do this.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: All right, damn you... You do realize Marshal has the contract for law enforcement throughout the city? They are the law in Denver.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Yeah, we've met.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Well then...  Officially, Maverick Incorporated condemns you and your actions as unlawful... and the pain in the asshole. Increase your codec encryption. Do not worry about the lag.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: And unofficially?

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: I'll do all I can over the codec to help. I do not like what those mudaki  are doing any more than you.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Spasiba, tovarich, spasiba. (Thank you, comrade, thank you.]
[He takes the elevator to the offices.]

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: Raiden, you will find an elevator inside that office. Use it to reach the roof. Traveling atop buildings will minimize enemy encounters.
[Raiden takes the other elevator and calls Doktor.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Dok, what's your status?

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: I am reviewing the pre-flight checklist now. I have hired contractors to handle shipping the brain units. We should be airborne in just a few minutes...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: You sure you can pilot that chopper by yourself?

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Raiden -- of course! Need I remind you that we live in the golden age of unmanned flight? Even manned helicopters possess a robust semi-automatic mode. It is simple, really. So simple that I can continue to monitor your status and World Marshal security from the pilot's seat! I must say, for the world's largest PMC, their security procedures are quite poor -- quite poor. Sadly I did not have the necessary permissions to overwrite their plans. Nevertheless, the data I did find should prove most useful. So please, do feel free to contact me whenever you like.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Appreciate it, Dok.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Well, it's not every day one has the chance to collect so many brains... think of the data! The research! ...Oh, and of course your personal safety was a concern as well...
[Raiden runs on rooftops, killing ground and air enemies.]

Speaker: Blade Wolf (via codec)
Text: You cannot proceed any further via the rooftops. There is a freight railroad underground. The elevator ahead will take you to it.
[Raiden cuts the door to the elevator and then cuts the cables of the elevator itself, which leads to a sharp fall of a multi-ton iron box. Thanks to his robotic legs, Raiden does not die in a fall.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: This must be the railroad...

Speaker: Blade Wolf (via codec)
Text: It would appear so. Likely part of Denver's old system. This city was a major transport hub in the early years of freight trains. This particular line appears to have been abandoned some time ago. It was originally constructed to transport supplies to an underground factory. But now it seems even the electrical system is no longer functioning.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Yeah, It's pitch black in here...

Speaker: Blade Wolf (via codec)
Text: As a cyborg, I trust this is not a serious concern.
[Moving with the help of his enhanced vision, Raiden's bypassing the patrolling robotic gorillas.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: They still have not noticed you. Do not expose yourself.

Speaker: Blade Wolf (via codec)
Text: There is a maintenance shaft up ahead. Use it to return to the surface.
[Raiden's getting out into town.]

Speaker: Blade Wolf (via codec)
Text: Raiden. It would appear your only way forward is to return to the surface. You will exit into an evacuated commercial district. Security is heavy, but you need not worry about collateral damage when engaging the enemy.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: About time... Finally I can cut loose.

Speaker: Blade Wolf (via codec)
Text: Proceed to the right from the exit. You will find a stairway on your right. Those stairs lead to a shortcut to World Marshal headquarters. Do not be distracted by the advertisements. You are not here as a tourist.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Sure, I'll just buy a quick souvenir or two for Rose and that'll be it.

Speaker: Blade Wolf (via codec)
Text: Raiden, we must hurry.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: ...Remind me to teach you about sarcasm sometime.

Speaker: Blade Wolf (via codec)
Text: I understand your attempts at humor. I simply do not find them entertaining.
[Raiden takes to the street and starts killing.]

Speaker: Blade Wolf (via codec)
Text: Raiden, you have almost reached World Marshal headquarters. It appears there are enemies on the overpass. I suggest cutting the road supports. That should bring it down.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Enemy ahead, Raiden. Avoid fighting if you can... Head for the next objective marker.

Speaker: Blade Wolf (via codec)
Text: The stock LQ-84 Fenrir. Unable to speak. A real dog has a far greater intellect.
[Raiden kills a lot of soldiers on the stairs to the square. At the very top, broadcasted through huge street screens, he receives a call from Jetstream Sam.]

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: Seriously now, Raiden, isn't this all a bit much? Any decent lunatic would've quit after Mexico.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Jetstream Sam.

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: I heard you chopped the lab director in half. Old habits die hard, oh, Jack? But now here you are, the child soldier, fighting for the children. Ah, but you're a man on a mission, aren't you... Gonna fix everything. Just you and your little sword there. Solve everything with violence, is that it?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: My sword is a means to an end: to protect those you'd pray on.

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: Really? Lemme ask you: All those cyborgs you've killed, up to now... Maybe they weren't kids, but they were people. You ever think about them? When you're chopping them into hamburger?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: They’re adults. They… made their choice.
[A video of Sam moving through various advertising signs as if he were walking on the square.]

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: Sure, they're adults. Sure they signed up for this. Right on the dotted line of their PMC contract. Usually they're no strangers to war. In fact, many times they already lost a limb or two. Many times they were out of work and starving on the street. So yes... They sign up for surgery, to fight God-knows-where. How else would you provide for your family when your country's embroiled in civil war? Pain receptors shut down, pumped full of fear-inhibiting nanomachines, and sent right into the blender... your blender… But they made their choice, right? Open your eye and see, Raiden.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I've seen plenty.

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: Then listen. Those battlefield emotions that the nanos suppress... Listen to them.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: What are you talking about?

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: Shhhh...
[Two policemen show up armed with batons.]

Speaker: Policeman
Text: There he is! Kill him!

Speaker: Policeman’s Thoughts
Text: Can we take him?

Speaker: Policeman 2
Text: What's wrong?

Speaker: Policeman’s 2 Thoughts
Text: The way he killed all the others... Oh God. Please, God... don't let me die.
[When Raiden hears that, he's overwhelmed by hesitation. But he still goes into battle.]

Speaker: Policeman 2
Text: Let's do this!

Speaker: Policeman’s Thoughts
Text: I have a family! This isn't fair.

Speaker: Policeman
Text: Little punk!

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: Listen closely now.

Speaker: Policeman’s Thoughts
Text: I didn't ask for this life!

Speaker: Policeman’s 2 Thoughts
Text: I watched my wife and son die... This is all I had left.

Speaker: Policeman 2
Text: You ain't shit!

Speaker: Policeman’s Thoughts
Text: Goddamn IED took my legs. I needed a job!

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Stop!

Speaker: Policeman’s Thoughts
Text: I didn't know what I was signing up for!
[Raiden loses his concentration and gets a baton in the face. Sam's celebrating.]

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: Is something the matter, Raiden?

Speaker: Policeman’s Thoughts
Text: I've nearly saved enough to bring mama to the States...

Speaker: Policeman 2
Text: Finish him off!

Speaker: Policeman’s 2 Thoughts
Text: Whatever it takes to be free of this torture!

Speaker: Raiden
Text: STOP IT!

Speaker: Policeman’s Thoughts
Text: What am I even fighting for...? We finally make it to the States, and for this...? How the hell did I wind up like this, fighting for these guys...? Jesus Christ... What the hell was I thinking? Why would I do this to myself? Even moving to America... Didn't change anything...
[Raiden kills the policemen, but it was very hard for him. He's morally exhausted. His motivation is at zero.]

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: Raiden, are you injured?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I thought they had a choice. A fair choice. Not like you.

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: People are different.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: As opposed to AIs? You're all the same, huh? You and your brothers. Manipulating mankind for our own good.

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: It appears my statement has upset you. I apologize.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: No, it's... I know you're right.

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: As for AIs, we adapt as we learn. Just as any intellect operates, man or machine. Altering the course of mankind is not among my defined directives.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I guess that's a relief.

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: Samuel's behavior does not match established parameters.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: You know him?

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: Affirmative. We served together on three previous missions. He proved most capable.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: You think highly of him.

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: I have always found him... dependable. Until now. Scouting data for the next area. I’ll patrol ahead. You follow…
[Raiden's going to the World Marshal Building, but... he barely moves his legs. The recent emotional shock has completely knocked him out.]

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: Raiden: Your current emotional state appears Highly volatile. I am sure you do not intend to abort the mission, but I suggest you avoid combat for the time being.
[Raiden manages to avoid most fights, but in the building itself he has to fight three soldiers.]

Speaker: Soldier’s Thoughts
Text: Those fuckers tricked me... They just told me what I wanted to hear... And when the war was over, they just threw me away... I didn't know it would be like this... I trusted them! Why did I trust them? Stupid! Stupid! I couldn't even help rebuild...

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: I know, Jack, I know...
[Sam's walking slowly to him.]

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: Not so black and white now, is it? Is your cause just, or is that "just" what you tell yourself?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Fuck you.
[Raiden's lying on the floor, he's completely emotionally exhausted. From the height of the building, he hear a voice.]
How pleased you are to chop away, Jack the Ripper. My name is Monsoon... of the Winds of Destruction.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Yeah... I guessed as much.
[Monsoon is jumping off the building. Parts of his robotic body are separating, absorbing the impact of the landing.]

Speaker: Monsoon
Text: Feasting on the insides of your enemies. How easily you ignore the loss of life when it suits your convenience. So tell me: Who saves the weak from the man who saves the weak?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: You're the ones exploiting them. You take advantage of their weakness.... of course they get hurt when you set them up as your human shield.

Speaker: Monsoon
Text: Kill or be killed, Jack. Phnom Penh taught me that.
[We're going into first-person mode. Monsoon goes back and forth and talks to Raiden, while the soldiers standing on the sides and do all kinds of stuff.]

Speaker: Monsoon
Text: Yes, you aren't the only one to grow up on the killing fields. War is a cruel parent, but an effective teacher. Its final lesson is carved deep in my psyche: That this world, and all its people, are diseased. Free will is a myth. Religion is a joke. We are all pawns, controlled by something greater: Memes. The DNA of the soul. They shape our will. They are the culture -- they are everything we pass on. Expose someone to anger long enough, they will learn to hate. They become a carrier. Envy, greed, despair... All memes. All passed along.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: How about "full of shit"? Is that a meme?

Speaker: Monsoon
Text: You can't fight nature, Jack. Wind blows, rain falls, and the strong prey upon the weak. Sam tells me you see your weapon as a tool. Something that saves lives -- a means of justice. Now there's a pretty meme. Exquisite! It's spared you the burden of all the lives you've taken... Absolved you of guilt when you enjoyed it.
[First person mode is off.]

Speaker: Monsoon
Text: That is, until the illusion was broken. Don't be ashamed. It's only nature, running its course. You have no choices to make. Nothing to answer for. You can die with a clear conscience.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: You're right. About me, I mean. I know something was... off. After the Patriots, I thought I could walk off the battlefield and into a normal life. But here I am, surrounded by death, arguing philosophy with terrorists. I told myself this was about justice. About protecting the weak. But I was wrong.

Speaker: Monsoon
Text: Then you admit it?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I learned young that killing your enemies felt good. Really good. In America, my friends... my family... They helped me forget the devil inside. But who am I kidding? I was born to kill. The bit about my sword -- that "means of justice" stuff? I guess I needed something to keep “the Ripper” in check when I was knee-deep in bodies.

Speaker: Monsoon
Text: You...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: But you -- all this -- is a wake-up call to what I really believe. What I really am.

Speaker: Monsoon
Text: What are you saying...?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I'm saying Jack is back.
[Raiden's eye is turning red.]

Speaker: Monsoon
Text: Kill him!
[A soldier runs up to Raiden and pierces him with a sword. Raiden laughs maniacally. Everyone's in shock. Sam's excited.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Doktor. Turn off my pain inhibitors.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: What? This... This is madness! You--

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Do it!

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: All right…
[He presses a few buttons and Raiden embraces the piercing pain. He grabs a sword in his body.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Pain… This is why I fight.
[He joyfully takes the sword out of his body, flooding the floor with blood. His exoskeleton begins to be glowing with red LEDs.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: This is my normal. My nature.

Speaker: Monsoon
Text: You've lost your mind.
[Raiden slaughters two soldiers and puts his sword up front.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Who's next?

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: I'll take this dance.

Speaker: Monsoon
Text: No, Sam. Report back to the chief. He's mine.

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: You're the boss.
[Sam leaves.]

Speaker: Monsoon
Text: I've misjudged you. You are like us after all. (smiles]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Now you're just being nasty. That nickname you love so much -- wanna know how I got it? Actually -- why don't give you a demonstration? I think it's time for Jack... to let 'er rip!

[They're starting to fight. Monsoon swiftly attacks Raiden with his sais, uses magnetism to throw helicopters and tanks at him, collects tons of different debris into the real wheel of death, and at the end tries to nail him with a monument.]

Speaker: Monsoon
Text: I hope you choke! You'll rot here. Forget it. That your best? Back to the earth with you! Am I... too weak? This one's on me! Left hand rule! Magnetic power! Too fast for that. Does it hurt? Welcome to my utopia of death! Magnetic force, Jack! Nature's force! Damn, you're good... Lororitz force! Go! I have won this! Who knows where I'll come from? Give it up! Too fast for that. Death approaches. So this is Jack's terrifying true form, huh? You lost this one! Have a smoke! I'll put you under, weakling. Now what will you do, Jack the Ripper? You're dead!

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Go as you please.
[Raiden runs on the monument, wildly beats Monsoon with his heel and cuts off his head.]

Speaker: Monsoon’s Head (via codec)
Text: Kill… or be killed

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Don't be ashamed. It's only nature, running its course. Your memes... end here.

Speaker: Monsoon’s Head (via codec)
Text: No, I passed one... to you... Sure as the sun… will rise... The slaughter... will continue... Now I return... to the earth... Wind blows, rain falls… the strong... prey... on the weak. All... is as it should... be...
[He gives out his last breath and dies. The red LEDs on Raiden’s exoskeleton turns off.]

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: Raiden?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I'm fine, Kevin. Relax. I'll get the brains.  I don't want this... for anyone else.

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: All right, man. Later.
[At the crack of thunder Raiden enters the World Marshal building.]

Speaker: FILE R-04
Text: Hostile Takeover
[At the entrance to the building, Raiden hears Sundowner's voice through the speakers.]

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: You killed Monsoon. I’m impressed. The brains are in the server room undergoing training. Knock yourself out. Go nuts.
[He's approaching reception.]

Speaker: Robot-Receptionist
Text: I'm sorry, sir. Our business hours for the day have ended. We are looking forward to your next visit.
[Raiden chops off her head and he gets attacked by security.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Watch out! They keep on coming!
[After the fight.]

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Raiden, Sundowner contacted you from the top floor. Time to make your way up there. The elevators appear to be disabled... Which we... should have expected, I suppose.

Speaker: Blade Wolf (via codec)
Text: I will access the control unit -- perhaps you can hack an elevator, and make it operational.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Ooh, splendid idea! By all means, yes! ...Hmm? It seems the guards are storming the building... Raiden, get back to the entrance! Buy me some time to get this elevator operational. You can control that UGT [unmanned guard tower] as well, yes? Give them hell!
[Raiden shoots soldiers with a machine gun.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Do not stray too far from the elevators, Raiden. Use the weapons around you to slow them down. Throw everything at them you can!

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Wunderbar! (Wonderful!) My hack was a success! Board the elevator, Raiden. For security purposes, the building is divided into upper and lower halves. The lower area consists of offices and meeting space for staff and visitors... While confidential military projects and technical research are restricted to the upper levels.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: So that's where the brains and server room'll be -- up top.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Indeed. But that elevator can only access the lower floors. You need to get to the 20th floor and past the security gate there to reach the upper area.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Lemme guess: time to find another left hand?

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Well, that is the problem. Security cyborgs would not have sufficient clearance... But managers and senior staff have already been evacuated, no doubt…

Speaker: Raiden
Text: So...

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: The only option is to cut the power to the security gate... Which will not be easy. It is powered by no less than three systems, including a backup power supply. You will need to destroy all of the electrical control panels to disable them. In any case, you should arrive at the 20th floor soon. The electrical panels are most likely hidden in the walls. Use your Enhanced AR search for any unusual heat sources inside the walls there.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: There should be an electrical panel nearby. Use your Enhanced AR to locate it.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Gahh, they found you! No choice now.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Good. One down, two to go. Keep at it, Raiden. Excellent. Just one more! They keep on coming!

[While Raiden is looking for electrical panels, he sees a photo of a lush Japanese woman in which the most interesting places are covered with yellow duct tape. He doesn't hesitate and cuts the tape.]

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: That's my boy.
[Soon all the panels were cut into pieces.]

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Yes, that should take care of security. Now head back to the gate.
[Raiden manages to get past it.]

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Raiden... Shall I activate your pain inhibitors now?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: No. Keep 'em off. I need it this way.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Ah. ...Well, as you wish. I must say. I have turned more than a few men into cyborgs, but you... Well, your past is most... Ah...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Whatcha getting at, Dok? Most of the time you're working with First World ex-military -- grown men. Compared to the average Third World child soldier, I can't really complain. Most of 'em, they're the sort of “guerrillas” your typical patient gets paid to slaughter.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Perhaps, but...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: This shouldn't be news to you. Dok.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Yes… Yes… But--

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Look, just help me take care of those brains after I bring ‘em back. I do my business, you do yours.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Y-Yes...
[As soon as he opens the next door, flying soldiers enter the building through the window.]

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: They're pouring in from everywhere! This is crazy...

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: You do not have to fight every enemy you encounter, Raiden. Try and keep moving.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Nice of them to blow open a door for me, ja?  Idiots!

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: All these Sliders in the area... Perhaps they could be put to use?
[Raiden jumps out of a window in style and starts jumping on flying soldiers' winged packs.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Keep climbing like that! It will be much easier for you!
[Raiden manages to climb the top floors of the building. Halfway through, he just ran up the steep wall, dodging the wreckage.]

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Quite a ways up now, ja?  Almost there! I have just finished analyzing their latest security data. You should find an indoor garden up ahead.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: A garden? Sounds fancy.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: A Japanese garden, to be precise. It is an area set aside for VIPs. Apparently one of World Marshal's directors is a rather serious Japanese culture enthusiast.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: All right, so what's this got to do with me? Is there something I need from the garden?

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Not at all! You need only pass through that area to arrive at a freight elevator. I found a route to the elevator controls through the unit we hijacked downstairs. I have located the server room as well. You can reach it via the freight elevator.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Great work, Dok.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Elementary, my dear Raiden. Now head for the garden!
[Raiden walks through a Japanese garden, eliminating enemies like a real ninja.]

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: The main exit is sealed. I very much doubt you can get through there. The catwalk above you is connected to a corridor meant for transporting materials. You can take that to the elevator. All right. Follow the catwalk straight ahead to reach the elevator.

Speaker: Blade Wolf (via codec)
Text: My apologies, Raiden. I seem to have fallen behind.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: No worries. Actually, I should thank you.

Speaker: Blade Wolf (via codec)
Text: What are you talking about?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: If it wasn't for you, I wouldn't have gotten Jack back.

Speaker: Blade Wolf (via codec)
Text: Then... that is your true nature?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: More or less. Still interested?

Speaker: Blade Wolf (via codec)
Text: I find no reason to alter my objectives. From the moment we met you have acted on emotional urges. You speak of protecting those weaker than you. Such people number in the billions. It is impossible. You cannot save every human being in the world. You cannot save every street child. After extended observation, I have come to a conclusion: Your actions are rooted in affinity for those from similar circumstances as yours.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Guess so. Not much of a superhero after all, huh?

Speaker: Blade Wolf (via codec)
Text: However your emotional status is understandable. Perhaps I share this same affinity....

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Well, if that's what you "feel", then glad to have you along.

Speaker: Blade Wolf (via codec)
Text: Roger.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: You can reach the server room via the freight elevator just ahead.
[Raiden goes upstairs on the loading dock. He's being attacked by enemies from all sides.]

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Look up, Raiden. Another freight platform! Look out! Incoming! Careful, Raiden! The elevator cannot take much more of this! Jump to that adjacent platform! Odd... The platform is losing speed... Scheiße! (Fuck!) The tripods are interfering! Raiden! Clear them out of the shaft! Do not let them block that elevator!
[Raiden manages to survive.]

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: They are deploying security to the top floor to the freight elevators. Your path to the server room leads... right through them.
[Raiden successfully gets to the top of the building and goes to the labs.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: The server room's ahead?

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Yes, according to what I have here.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: What should I expect to find...? If they're VR training those brains, I'm guessing it won't look like your typical IT department.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Quite right. Most of it will likely be occupied by life-support units... Feeding oxygen and nutrition to the brains they have stored, you know. They would also need a server to feed them the VR date, but in terms of structure... It's really more brain storage and maintenance than a server room. But no doubt it mailers a convenient euphemism for what they are really doing there.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Yeah, like how CIA agents refer to where they work as "The Company."

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Indeed! Something like that would never arouse the suspicions of rank-and-file staff who may fear it. And I am sure those complicit in this operation feel better not calling it the “VR training room.” Even something so simple as a name can help one ignore the truth of what they are doing. Truly fascinating, how the human brain works...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: So this... whatever room -- that's where Sundowner's waiting, right? If he wants a fight, I wish he'd just got on with it. He didn't seem the type to run and hide.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Well, he is in charge of security... But I suspect this is not about business. If I had to guess I would say he is toying with you. Testing you, perhaps.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Whatever he’s doing, it won't change what's going to happen once I finally catch up with him...
[He enters the next room and sees a familiar face.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: What? Mistral?! But she's --

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: No -- a spare body, if I had to guess. Likely controlled by an AI.
[Raiden cuts her to parts.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: And a spare Monsoon? Well, if it's AI-controlled it should pose no problem for you, yes?
[Raiden slices him, too.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Keep going, Raiden! You are almost to the server room.

[The next room is a large hall with many columns on the sides. In the center there is a small path that ends with a staircase to the second floor. From the top of the second floor Sundowner roars loudly.]

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: Shhh, don't disrupt the students while class is in session. I believe you're familiar with the lesson plan... The same regimen you went through in Liberia. Effective program. Just look how you turned out. Of course, running it in the real world just got a bit too... complicated. Doing it virtually though? No fuss, no muss. Straight to the brain. It's like a dream. Well, maybe “dream” is the wrong word. They do kill some POWs... some civilians...  They enjoy it though. We give their pleasure centers a nice big jolt every time. Plus they got a shiny new body as a graduation present. Another thing you have in common...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I chose this. They're kids, you son of a bitch.

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: And kids are cruel. All people are, by nature -- they just lose touch with it as they get older. Start thinking they know right and wrong. “That's immoral!” War crime-this, Code of Conduct-that… Kids you can mold, manipulate into performing all kinds of atrocities -- and there's nothing like a good atrocity to keep a war going.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: That's why I'm shutting you down.

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: You just don't see the bigger picture, do ya? Say you bring this whole place down, waltz outta the rubble with all these precious brains… Nothing changes. All the guys in charge are long gone. And we've got offices 'round the world. We're just suppliers. We don't create the market for war.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Then who does? The Patriots are gone.

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: Those guys just managed the war economy -- they didn't invent it. Didja think every battle in history was all part of some big ol' conspiracy? Bullshit! War is just part'a who we are. Why fight it? Anyway, none of this will matter in three hours. Demand for PMCs is about to skyrocket. Like the good ol' days after 9-11.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: What are you talking about?

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: Not here. Follow me.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Raiden, get Sundowner! Do not lose him this time!
[Raiden goes upstairs and gets out on the heliport.]

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: How's this, Jack? We can play up here without damaging the merchandise.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: What happens in three hours?

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: Don't matter you're too late. Even at Mach 2 you wouldn't make it. And killing you is gonna take some time: slow, and painful. Like I said, kids are cruel, Jack. And I'm very in touch with my inner child.
[Sundowner turns on his six-segment shield and takes out his two sword shears. The fight begins.]

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: You can be crueler than that, Jack. Too slow! Don’t fuck with me, Jack! Beg for your life! Pointless. Tough luck. You can’t break this shield, Jack. C'mon, try 'n hit me! Christ…! I love this shit! I’ll bathe in your blood! I’ll split you in two! Th’fuck..?! Better than I thought. Son of a bitch... You… got me.
[He falls off the building but grabs a helicopter that's been flying around the whole time.]

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: Playtime's over, Jack. Time to die!
[He orders the helicopter to fire missiles. The missiles destroy the floor of the building and Raiden flies down the shaft of the freight platform.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Dammit.
[He grabs the flying wings and goes back to Sundowner. As he gets closer, Raiden throws the wings at him.]

Speaker: Sundowner
Text: Christ..!
[Raiden chops up the falling Sundowner into neat little pieces.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: It's over.

Speaker: Sundowner (via codec)
Text: Attaboy, Jack...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: What happens in three hours?!

Speaker: Sundowner (via codec)
Text: He'll... launch... Operation... Tecumesh...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Who? Armstrong?

Speaker: Sundowner (via codec)
Text: I've already said too much... I have a call to make...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Cut yourself shaving?

Speaker: Sundowner (via codec)
Text: Asshole. He’s good... real good... You knew this would happen, didn't ya... Well, you'll get your wish... Up to you, now, Sam…
[The call ends.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Raiden here. I've taken Marshal HQ.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Ja, ja… (Yes, yes…) I have just entered Denver airspace. I will be there soon.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Hurry.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Raiden -- what Sundowner said...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I know. Anything that I rival 9-11 cannot be good...

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: And in three hours... Maybe less... Hmm... He said even Mach 2 could not get there in time...

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: If he was serious, that's... Over 4,000 miles away...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: 4,500. So whatever it is. it's not happening on American soil...

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: If it's going to spike demand for PMCs, it's gotta be a political hot spot... A coup or civil war in a stable region wouldn't have a domino effect...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: And they'd want to draw in a superpower… No.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: What?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: The president. He's on his way to Pakistan. If something happens to him there...

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: ...Oh, shit. The war on terror, part two.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Contact the military.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Official channels are frozen since Mexico. Unofficial channels would take too long.

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: Besides, what's our proof? Who's going to believe us over World Marshal?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Then we have to get there first.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Nevozmozhno! Impossible! It is the other side of the planet! Even if we were in world's fastest jet right now. it's not even close.

Speaker: Courtney (via codec)
Text: Hold up. It's not a jet we need...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Courtney?

Speaker: Courtney (via codec)
Text: An RLV would make it with time to spare.

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: That's...

Speaker: Courtney (via codec)
Text: MACH 23, if we're talking one atmosphere. 17.650 miles per hour. (28400 km/h]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: That would make Pakistan in... under half an hour.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Right. Contact Solis.

Speaker: FILE R-05
Text: Escape From Denver

Speaker: Radio
Text: Cargo's all set to go, sir.

Speaker: Doktor
Text: Excellent. Commencing take-off in semi-auto mode. You know, this kind of space launch once required days of preparation…
[They're taking off.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Solis has been conducting test flights almost every day for the last six months. As long as we're not breaking atmosphere, they said they can reroute today's flight, no problem.

Speaker: Doktor
Text: Amazing... “The Earth is the cradle of humanity, but mankind cannot stay in the cradle forever.”

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I'm only going as far as the thermosphere. This thing can't pass the Kármán line. That lunar vacation will just have to wait.

Speaker: Doktor
Text: And here I was hoping you might bring me back a monolith.
[Something on the control panel is starting to beep ominously.]

Speaker: Doktor
Text: Scheiße! (Fuck!) Two bogeys, closing fast!

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Is it--?

Speaker: Doktor
Text: Who else? The flight pattern suggests unmanned MQ-320s.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Shit.

Speaker: Doktor
Text: This is a transport chopper, our defensive options are limited. Missiles incoming!
[There are several missiles flying towards the helicopter, but the Doctor manages to shoot them down.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: EMP?

Speaker: Doktor
Text: Yes, but not strong enough to take out the drone. Here they come.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I'll handle this.

Speaker: Doktor
Text: Raiden...! Have a nice flight.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: And people say Germans aren't funny.
[He's jumping out of a helicopter right on one of the drones. Raiden uses his sword to destroy its electronic brains, so the drone only starts flying straight.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: There it is... All right... Bring the chopper around.
[With his sword ready, he cuts the second drone into two pieces right in the air.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Okay, I'm coming back!

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: This is easier said than done, you know!
[He notices that the drone that Raiden's standing on is on fire.]

Speaker: Doktor
Text: Raiden!
[The drone explodes and Raiden takes the blast. Doktor flies closer and Raiden grabs a helicopter, but he can't hold on.]

Speaker: Doktor
Text: Raiden! I am sorry, my friend...  Your sacrifice will not be forgotten.
[Mercenaries trying to hit him off the ground and he has to fly away. Raiden lands in town, punching a hole in the asphalt.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: That was quite the fall, Raiden. I am glad to see you are all right. It's time you got out of Denver.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Raiden! Are you all right?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I can handle this. You just get those brains outta here.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: And what will you do?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Get out of here, and to the launch site.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Ah, the young lady's company, ja?  How fortunate they are in Colorado, too.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Yeah, shouldn't take more than two hours with a set of wheels. Guess I'll just have to "borrow" some. A lot of cars got abandoned when the evac order came down.

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: But... won't the roads be blocked? If you are struck by one of those missiles or--

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I know. Lemme just worry about putting some distance between mu and World Marshal… What's left of it.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Raiden, hurry! It may be an RLV, but it still needs time to accelerate and decelerate from first cosmic velocity. It could require more than 30 mins to set to Pakistan. I have located a route with relatively light security. I will mark the heading on your soliton radar.

Speaker: Blade Wolf (via codec)
Text: Raiden. I will join you in Pakistan. I will find a way to exit the helicopter. Proceed out of the city. I will contact you when I am on the ground.
[Raiden is approaching the city border.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: You have escaped the pursuit?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Seems like it.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: You have passed the last of the barricades. Save your strength -- find a vehicle.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Right.
[He sees a chopper.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: That should do nicely.

[After stealing a motorcycle, Raiden leaves a note... by carving it with his sword on the asphalt where the motorcycle was standing. "I need your bike. Thank you for your cooperation. 111 555 (the rest is unreadable)”]

Speaker: FILE R-06
Text: Badlands Showdown
[Raiden rides on a dusty American road on a motorcycle with heavy metal on the background.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Everything okay on your side?

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: I am out of Colorado air space -- and nothing on the radar

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Good. I'm almost there.
[He sees Blade Wolf on the road and stops. He was petted by… Jetstream Sam.]

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: Raiden.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Having a little heart-to-heart?

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: I have analyzed his words and actions. I am unable to ascertain his motivation.

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: Fancy meeting you here.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: You knew I'd come. I suppose I should thank you for not killing everyone at the launch site?

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: Well, not if you say it like that.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: For a hired killer, you're not very good at your job.

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: The war is the big payoff!

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Right. Big raises all around once World Marshal gets all those contracts...

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: I’m not talking about money, Jack. I'm talking ideals.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Excuse me?

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: Forget it. We've both heard enough speeches about higher causes by now. History will decide who's right. End of story.
[Raiden defiantly gets off the bike for the second time and nods his head to point to Sam on the prairie near the road and leaves the bike right in the middle of the road.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I don't care who thinks I'm right. And I've got cause enough for killing you.

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: Wh--? Oh, good. Why that's very good! Yes, I like that.

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: Must you really fight?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Don't interfere.

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: This is between us.
[They unshealth their swords.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: And it ends here.

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: OK. Let's dance.
[The fateful fight begins.]

Speaker: Jetstream Sam
Text: Pathetic… Show me a good time Jack! Not good enough. You're a waste of money. Far too easy. Amateur! Now THIS is a fight! Just you and me, Jack. Get ready! That's the spirit, Jack. Say goodnight... pretty boy! Just getting started.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Play time's over.
[He pierce his sword right into Sam’s chest.]

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: He is dead...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: He barely had any cyborg enhancements...

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: Was this outcome necessary? Evidence: inconclusive.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I guess even AIs don't know everything.

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: It is likely no single correct answer exists. Additionally, human conflict stems from opposing ideals and societal norms. I was not programmed with these guidelines.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: You're better off figuring those out for yourself.
[He picked up Sam’s red katana.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: ID-locked...

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: A VT7 high-frequency blade. The efficacy of the enhancement directly correlates to the quality of the original weapon. My file indicates Sam inherited the sword from his father.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Going to bury it?

Speaker: Blade Wolf
Text: I will retain it in memory of Sam.
[Raiden pathosly takes his sword to the sheath and gives it to Blade Wolf.]

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Raiden, we have less than one hour! Hurry!

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Roger that.

Speaker: FILE R-07
Text: Assassination Attempt

[Raiden arrives at Solis Space & Aeronautics, where he is met by the world's most incompetent security guard - J.William. He reads manga and eats pizza instead of watching the cameras and the incoming visitors.]

Speaker: J.William’s Thoughts
Text: Oh...oh... Hikari-chan! So kawaii...
[Blade Wolf rushes to the security booth. Brain dead guard takes his tables with the picture of Raiden and asks Blade Wolf...]

Speaker: J.William
Text: Are you, uh... Mr. Raiden? Sir?
[Raiden opens the gates with his bare cyborg hands.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Where is she?

Speaker: J.William
Text: I'll... tell her you've arrived.

Speaker: Voice
Text: Over here.
[The most unrealistic rocket scientist in the world approaches him. Japan has only the best.]

Speaker: Sunny Emmerich
Text: Hi there, stranger.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Hey. You're looking good.

Speaker: Sunny Emmerich
Text: Aww, who's your little friend?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: It's a long story.

Speaker: Sunny Emmerich
Text: Shaaake... Good boy!

Speaker: Sunny Emmerich
Text: I guess we don't really have time to catch up...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Sorry -- not really.

Speaker: Sunny Emmerich
Text: It's okay. Follow me.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: So, exactly what kind of--

Speaker: Sunny Emmerich
Text: You’ll see.
[He sees a huge, ultramodern jet fighter worth billions of dollars.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: YOU built that?

Speaker: Sunny Emmerich
Text: Yep. It uses a hybrid LACE / ramjet engine I designed. Well? Are you in a hurry or not?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Right. Hey -- thanks, Sunny.
[She laughs with a naive childish laugh. That's because in this world it's not worth millions to just roll this thing out of a hangar. Raiden gets in the cockpit.]

Speaker: Sunny Emmerich (via codec)
Text: The flight plan is already set. You're good to go. Please switch off all cell phones and portable gaming devices, and remember this is a no-smoking flight.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Roger. Ready for countdown.

Speaker: Sunny Emmerich (via codec)
Text: No time for that! Ignition!
[The fighter takes off and rushes sharply into the sky. The guard keeps laughing at the manga he's reading.]
[Raiden lands on Pakistani land near the military base.]

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: Well? Anything?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Nothing. You sure we got the right place?

Speaker: Kevin (via codec)
Text: Gotta be. It's the only base big enough with security contracted out to World Marshal.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: All right, I'm headed in.
[He begins to slice up the military.]

Speaker: Doktor (via codec)
Text: Ha ha, more classified data! I believe I have all I need for a little surprise...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: You see that? Their XIFF Codes show up as “unaffiliated.”

Speaker: Courtney (via codec)
Text: Wait -- Marshal has the security contract for this base... Why would they have their cyborgs set to the same illegal XIFF code as Desperado? It's evidence against them...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: No, it's their alibi. They're making it look like Desperado hacked their soldiers on-site. Because everyone knows Desperado has a contract with…

Speaker: Courtney (via codec)
Text: The Pakistani rebels. But if we go public with the Desperado-Marshal connection--

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Won't matter. Not when they’ve got this nice, big foreign threat all cooked up and ready to serve. The media and the public won't be able to resist. Remember WMDs in Iraq?

Speaker: Courtney (via codec)
Text: Dammit... you're right. It's another “slam dunk”. What about any humans on the base? Marshal only handled security.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Dead, most likely. Or brain-jacked, If they needed them to keep up appearances.

Speaker: Courtney (via codec)
Text: Hmm... They'd never publicize what airport the president was flying into. Not in this region. And almost no one would have access to an outside line, for security reasons. It wouldn't be difficult to keep things hush-hush... At least until Air Force One arrives.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: I'm heading for the control tower. If I can destroy the antenna array, the U.S. military will know something's wrong.

Speaker: Courtney (via codec)
Text: Good idea -- be careful.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Sam's gone, and I blew the Winds of Destruction away. I'll be fine.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Raiden, there’s no time to worry about the soldiers. Got to the control tower!
[Raiden runs through the hangar, not paying attention to the military. As he leaves the hangar, he sees Blade Wolf severely damaged.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Wolf?! Where are they...?

[The asphalt starts crumbling and Raiden falls down. He jumps on rocks and chops up the neon wreckage, he comes out to the surface. A metal monster, Metal Gear EXCELSUS, crawls to him from a hole in the ground. Senator Stephen Armstrong comes out of the Metal Gear cabin. He smokes a cigar.]

Speaker: Steven Armstrong
Text: Well if it isn't saucy Jack? Just a little too late, as usual.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Armstrong? Impressive little toy you've got there. But your plan ends here.

Speaker: Steven Armstrong
Text: Idiot. You're not ending our plan, you're expanding it. Checked the internet lately?

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Pfft.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Raiden! Air Force One is turning back to the States!

Speaker: Raiden
Text: What? How'd they know?!

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: Someone posted photos of what's happening on the base. The whole world is up in arms!

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Show me!

[He opens around 30 tabs in his preinstalled browser - CNET News “Terrorists Bombard Pakistani Airbase”, some website “Over 40 Americans presumed dead in Pakistani terror strike”, TufNews “Hamilton Assassination Attempt in Pakistan”.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: How did they...? The story leaked early...? Then Marshal's plan is ruined.

Speaker: Boris (via codec)
Text: The hell it is! Look what they're saying! The story just went live and already they are calling for blood!
[And now we are shown very authoritative comments under the news on the Internet, which have so much influence on politics.]

Speaker: 4NuB1S-DC
Text: WAKE UP! The Pakistani government is HARBORING these terrorists!! (492 likes, 3 dislikes]

Speaker: BG_MAD-TORGO-X
Text: HEY, UNCLE SAM! PAKISTAN NEEDS A BOOT UP THEIR ASS!!!1 (7483 likes, 52 dislikes]

Speaker: Unknown user
Text: Pakistan is part of the AXIS OF EVIL!

Speaker: Raiden
Text: But the president was saved…?

Speaker: Steven Armstrong
Text: And yet American blood was spilled.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: By Americans! Besides, a few dozen soldiers is tragic, but nothing to start a major war over.

Speaker: Steven Armstrong
Text: That's just the spark, son. The excuse we've been waiting for. America's wanted this war for years. The Patriots -- they knew war was good for the economy. Four years later their legacy lingers on...

Speaker: Raiden
Text: The memes...

Speaker: Steven Armstrong
Text: They left us their great "ism"s! Nationalism! Unilateralism! Materialism! Welcome maxims for these with no faith -- without guiding principles of their own. Give yourself up to the whole. No need to better yourself -- you're American! You're number one! Then the only value left is dollar value -- the economy. So we'll do whatever it takes to keep it humming along. Even war. Especially war.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Bullshit.

Speaker: Steven Armstrong
Text: The Patriots planted the seed -- we don't need them around to filter and foster their memes any longer. We're spreading them just fine ourselves. Every American man, woman and child... We're all sons of the Patriots now! We just need something to jump start the economy out of this funk. This recession it's been stuck in since the fall of SOP.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: And the military costs? Wasting billions is going to help the economy?

Speaker: Steven Armstrong
Text: PMCs, arms manufacturers... Job creators, Jack! All those workers spending money, paying taxes... Trust me, a little war can work wonders.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: So grease the gears with some innocent blood, is that it?

Speaker: Steven Armstrong
Text: Relax, Jack. It's a "war on terror." We're not out to kill civilians. Extremists. Lawless gangs. Madmen.
[Raiden’s astonished a little.]

Speaker: Steven Armstrong
Text: Of course that would have to include you. Wouldn't want any eyewitness reports completing the message.
[He throws a cigar away and climbs into the metal bridge cabin. Raiden prepares for battle.]

Speaker: Steven Armstrong
Text: Fear the wrath of the USA! So you like playin' hide-and-seek, y’little bitch? Crush you like a goddamn bug! Let's see how long you can keep it up... Fine. I'll give you that one. Ashes to ashes, motherfucker! If you're not with America, Jack, you're against her! Let loose the flames of justice! Uncle Sam needs you to die, Jack! Impressive, Jack. Most impressive. Hold still! Don't get touchy, kid!
[Raiden chops off Metal Gear's legs, grabs a multi-ton monster by the knife and throws it over his head. Then he rips off one of the knives and cuts off the Metal Gear with it.]

Speaker: Steven Armstrong
Text: About time we ended this... and you're going out with a bang!
[Armstrong comes out of a smoke-covered cabin.]

Speaker: Steven Armstrong
Text: Slippery little bastard. I don't have time for this.
[He gets up in the sumo stand and starts screaming intensely.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: Oh, you've gotta be kidding me!
[Wires are flying out of Metal Gear's legs, charging Armstrong with green energy. He's getting bigger and more pumped up.]

Speaker: Steven Armstrong
Text: Let's go!

Speaker: Raiden
Text: The hell are you thinking.
[Armstrong spreads out and knocks Raiden down. After that, he grabs his head and starts squeezing.]

Speaker: Steven Armstrong
Text: Played college ball, ya know.

Speaker: Raiden
Text: At some cushy Ivy League school.
[Armstrong rips off Raiden's visor and hits him in the face a few times.]

Speaker: Steven Armstrong
Text: Try University of Texas. Coulda gone pro if I hadn't joined the Navy. I'm not one of those beltway pansies. I could break the president in two with my bare hands.
[He throws Raiden in the air and then kicks him.]

Speaker: Steven Armstrong
Text: Don't fuck with this senator!

Speaker: Raiden
Text: What the hell are you...?

Speaker: Steven Armstrong
Text: Why don't you stick around and find out?
[The battle begins with the strongest senator in the world.]

Speaker: Steven Armstrong
Text: Let's not forget to enjoy this, hm? Man-to-man, I can't be beat. C'mon!
[Armstrong catches Raiden's sword with his bare hand.]

Speaker: Raiden
Text: What?
